availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pinceton, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Frances Cartwright in Caldwell County, Kentucky on October 12, 1837. Father of Mildred A. O'Hara, Reuben R. O'Hara, John L. O'Hara, Mary E. O'Hara, and William F. O'Hara. Married to Elizabeth E. Cartwright O'Hara in Caldwell County, Kentucky on June 18, 1849. Father of Irena R. O'Hara, James O'Hara, Paul O'Hara, Gracey O'Hara, Lucien O'Hara, Milton O'Hara, Lizzie O'Hara, and Cora O'Hara. Owned five enslaved people in 1840. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned nineteen enslaved people in 1860. Farmer in Princeton, Kentucky in 1860.
